today we are looking at some interesting words 
and phrases connected to what would appear to be a

very simple word we are looking at uses of over i 
know what you're thinking mr duncan that's a very

simple word but you might be surprised to find 
out how often it is used in other ways as well

in its general use the word over is a 
preposition relating to the position above

so we often think of over as referring 
to a position that is above something

where something is positioned whilst up in 
the air in relation to what is on the ground
we often use the word over

the airplane will go over your house the 
airplane goes over your house the airplane

went over your house so we are talking 
here we are talking future tents there

and then present tense and then past tense so 
you can use over in all of those situations

we can express this as over the top so when 
something goes above you and especially if

it's traveling in a certain direction we 
can say something is going over the top

we flew over the top of the mountains 
we flew over the top of the mountains

so that means you are high up and the the 
mountains were underneath you and quite often we

we use that when we are moving at the same 
time when you are going over something

to cover something also uses over 
for example put a white cloth

over the table top so you put something over 
another thing to cover something you put one thing

over another so if you are covering something 
sometimes we do it for safety sometimes we want

to protect something that might be easily 
damaged you will put something over the top

to climb across something can be expressed 
using the word over we will need to climb

over the fence so to get over something 
means you you have to go from one side

to another climbing over something you might have 
to go over a bridge you are crossing the river

but you are also going over the 
river and across or over the bridge

to express the movement of something also uses 
over as a preposition so the movement of something

for example i will come over later to help you 
i will come over later to help you that means i

will go to you it is expressing that movement 
from one place to another i will come over

later to help you to extend the 
view from a high vantage point

for example the view over the landscape 
is stunning so perhaps you are high up

on a mountain or a hill looking across and looking 
over the view over the landscape is stunning

and here's an interesting word as well vantage 
vantage if you have a position that you are

in that allows you to see clearly quite often 
we will we will describe it as a vantage point

vantage point it means a place or 
area that gives you a very good view

when expressing authority or control 
for example he has directorial control

over us you have control or 
maybe authority your boss

you might describe them as having authority 
they have control over you in your job

the act of ending something can be 
described as being over that is true

if something comes to an end you can say 
that it is over the relationship is over

you are too late the match is over 
it has come to an end it has finished

then we have uses of over in 
phrases for example over time

this describes extra work or if you are working 
late you are doing extra time you are working

overtime so if you have to work for 30 hours a 
week and maybe they ask for you to work another

five hours on top of that that will be described 
as overtime over step to go too far to exceed

authority it means you are going too far you have 
stepped over the line you overstep you go too far

over balance as i mentioned earlier my poor 
little heron in the garden unfortunately yesterday

blew over in the wind it lost its balance so if 
you lose your balance maybe you reach too far

and you lose your balance you lose stability 
we can say that you have over balanced

overture now this is a very interesting word 
because we we can use it in more than one way

maybe a piece of music that is used at the start 
of a performance can be described as an overture

but also to offer something or approach or 
suggest can also be described as an overture

overtone when we are in a room or a certain

think that is a super duper word nuance the nuance 
of something or maybe what will happen because of

that thing the implication so the mood the feeling 
around you you might talk about the overtones

a certain nuance or an implication in a certain 
place or during a certain time overstate here's

a good one people often overstate something 
maybe they exaggerate they say something that

is over the top they overstate they exaggerate 
a person maybe is trying to get some sympathy

for their illness but really there isn't very much 
wrong with them they overstate their problem they

exaggerate here's another one overhaul if you 
overhaul something it means you fix or refurbish

something maybe you have an old car that you've 
been driving for many years and now it's starting

to to break down and not work properly 
so perhaps your car will have to be

overhauled if you overhaul something it means 
you fix or refurbish something here's another one

overreact now earlier we had over act but this one 
is overreact an exaggerated response to something

so if you overreact to something it means your 
reaction is exaggerated you are making something

seem worse than it really is you overreact oh 
my goodness i can't believe it i can't believe

this has happened and someone might say oh mr 
duncan you really like to overreact to things

if you overreact it means you have an 
exaggerated response to something over the top

something that is over the top means to

over the top some people say that i when i'm

the top mr duncan when you are talking on your

it is a little over the top it is slightly 
exaggerated something that goes over and over

something that repeats again and again 
so to repeat something is to do something

over and over over and over again and again 
finally before i go you might say that two things

they are related joined or maybe one thing

covers another with no gap so overlap means one 
thing is going over another one hand overlaps

the other hand it goes over it overlaps there 
is no gap in between and that is it of course

there are many other uses of the word over for 
example overtake if you overtake someone it means

you go ahead of them maybe in a race two people 
are running one person will overtake the other

so there are actually many uses of the word 
over and i'm sure there are many more as well
